question_text:
Question 46
A batch settling experiment is performed in a long column using a dilute dispersion containing equal 
number of particles of type A and type B in water (density 
3
1000 kg m
−
) at room temperature.
Type A are spherical particles of diameter 
30 m
μ
 and density 
3
1100 kg m
−
.
Type B are spherical particles of diameter 
10 m
μ
 and density 
3
1900 kg m
−
.
Assuming that Stoke’s law is valid throughout the duration of the experiment, the settled bed would

GATE 2021 
 [Forenoon Session]
Chemical Engineering
PAGE
39

(A) Consist of type B particles only.
(B) Be completely segregated with type B particles on top of type A particles.
(C) Consist of a homogeneous mixture of type A and type B particles.
(D) Be completely segregated with type A particles on top of type B particles.
